Company: CashCall and Western Sky
Description: excessive interest rates

Company: CashCall Inc.
Description: CashCall Inc. agreed to pay $1.5 million in restitution in settlement of allegations it improperly calculated and charged illegally high interest rates and charged illegal fees.

Company: CashCall Inc.
Description: settled allegations of abusive debt collection practices
Info Source: Attorney General Morrisey Reaches $13M Settlement with CashCall Inc., Targeted News Service, November 25, 2015 (via Nexis).

Company: CashCall Inc., WS Funding
Description: CashCall Inc., WS Funding (a subsidiary) and their owner agreed to pay $100,000 in penalties and costs, return $1,862,573 to consumers and forgive remaining debts of more than $1 million in settlement of allegations it charged consumers ilegal interest rates and engaged in lending activities without obtaining the required Money Lender's License.

Company: CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall agreed to provide over $11.7 million in debt relief to customers in Minnesota, in settlement of allegations it violated state licensing, lending and ursury laws.

Company: CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall agreed to pay $15.335 million in restitution and debt relief as part of a settlement to resolve allegations that he online lender used a rent-a-tribe scheme to deceive consumers and collect illegal interest on online loans.

Company: CashCall, Inc., WS Funding, LLC, and Delbert Services Corporation
Description: The Attorney General's Office reached a settlement agreement with CashCall, Inc., WS Funding, LLC, and Delbert Services Corporation to resolve allegations that they made, serviced, and collected high-cost loans in violation of Colorado's consumer credit protection laws.
Info Source: Attorney General Cynthia H. Coffman Returns Nearly $8 Million to Victims of Unlawful Lending, Targeted News Service, June 8, 2016 (via Nexis).

Company: Western Sky Financial LLC, CashCall, Inc., WS Funding, LLC and Delbert Services Corp.
Description: Western Sky Financial LLC, CashCall, Inc., WS Funding, LLC, and Delbert Services Corp. agreed to jointly pay $1 million in restitution to settle allegations of unlawful lending.

Company: Western Sky Financial, CashCall Inc. and WS Funding
Description: Western Sky Financial, CashCall Inc., WS Funding and their owners jointly agreed to pay $750,000 to settle accusations of conspiring to offer illegal payday loans online to Arkansans while claiming to be affiliated with a Native American tribe.
Notes: Joint settlement is $500,000 restitution and $250,000 to Arkansas Consumer Education.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC
Western Sky Financial, LLC and CashCall, Inc.
Description: Western Sky Financial, LLC and CashCall, Inc. agreed to set up a $2.2 million settlement fund in settlement of allegations they made unlicensed loans with illegally high interest rates in to Michigan customers. Later releases note that the total monetary value of the settlement including cancelled and modified loans was $24.7 million.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC et al.
Description: Western Sky Financial, LLC; Payday Financial, LLC, doing business as Lakota Cash and Big Sky Cash; Great Sky Finance, LLC; Green Billow, LLC, doing business as Four Seasons Cash; and Red Stone Financial, LLC agreed to pay $560,000 in settlement of allegations they violated Colorado credit protection laws by making unlicensed loans to Colorado consumers.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC, CashCall, Inc.
Description: Western Sky Financial, LLC, CashCall, Inc. and related entities agreed to pay $23.5 million in restitution, forgive $17 million in loans and pay $1.5 million in penalties, fees and costs, in settlement of allegations they violated Georgia's Payday Lending Act by being an unlicenced lender and charging above the legal interest rate.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC, WS Funding, LLC, CashCall, Inc., Delbert Services Corp.
Description: Western Sky Financial, LLC, WS Funding, LLC, CashCall, Inc., Delbert Services Corporation, and their owners agreed to pay $388,231 (half suspended) and $65,000 in fees in settlement of allegations they provided unlicensed loans with illegally high interest rates.

Company: CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall agreed to pay $250,000 in settlement of allegations it violated state regulations governing payday lenders.
Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Financial Institutions before it merged with the Department of Insurance.

Company: CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall agreed to pay $1 millionin  penalties and costs, and additionally repay charges to borrowers, in settlement of allegations it misrepresented its loan terms and made false reports.
Agency: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation

Company: CashCall, Inc. and Western Sky Financial L.L.C.
Description: CashCall , Inc. and Western Sky Financial, L.L.C. agreed to pay a $350,000 civil penalty, $50,000 for consumer education, and restitution to customers in settlement of allegations they offered small high-interest loans without a license.

Company: CashCall, Inc., Western Sky Financial, LLC, WS Funding, LLC
Description: CashCall, Inc., Western Sky Financial, LLC, WS Funding LLC, plus two individuals, agreed to pay a $500,000 Administrative Fine in settlement of allegations they made unlicensed consumer finance loans (loans under $25,000 with interest rates over 18% APR) in the state.

Company: CashCall, Inc. and Western Sky Financial, LLC et al.
Description: CashCall, Inc. and Western Sky Financial et al. agreed to pay $80,200 to the state and to pay into a fund for restitution to customers, starting with $19,818, in settlement of allegations they made loans while unlicensed in the state and that were illegal under state law.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC and CashCall, Inc.
Agency: Michigan Department of Insurance and Financial Services
Info Source: SCHUETTE, FLOOD NET $2.2 MILLION FOR MICHIGAN CONSUMERS IN WESTERN SKY AND CASHCALL SETTLEMENT INVOLVING HIGH-INTEREST LOANS, States News Service, May 14, 2015 (via Nexis).

Company: Western Sky Financial LLC et al.
Agency: North Carolina Office of the Commissioner of Banks

Company: CashCall, Inc.
CashCall Inc. and WS Funding LLC
Description: unlicensed lending

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC et al.
CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall agreed to pay $1 million and forgive the debt of 6,000 customers in settlement of allegations it violated state requirements for lenders.

Company: Western Sky Financial, LLC
CashCall Inc. et al.
Description: charging excessive interest rates on consumer loans
Agency: Pennsylvania Department of Banking and Securities

Company: CashCall Inc.
Description: excessive interest rates
Agency: South Carolina Department of Consumer Affairs

Company: Cash Call Inc. and Western Sky Financial LLC
Description: Resolution of allegations of originating consumer loans with being licensed and charging interest rates in excess of state limits.
Agency: Washington State Department of Financial Institutions

Company: CashCall, Inc.
Description: CashCall was ordered to pay $6,131,694 in restitution, a $244,100 fine, and $14,875 in costs in a Final Decision and Order finding it facilitated illegal loan-making activity in the state by arranging loans to be serviced by its subsidiary Western Sky.
Agency: Washington State Department of Financial Institutions
